captions.text:
· “This episode brought to you by Meow
Mix Cat Food. Delight your cat with new mealtime
favorites.”

INTRO-----
HI GUYS I’M ALEX FARNHAM AND THIS IS ANIMALIST

NEWS.
YOU MAY HAVE NOTICED THAT CATS TEND TO GREET

EACH OTHER WITH A NOSE BUMP, BUT WHY IS THAT?
I MEAN, THINK ABOUT IT, PUTTING YOUR FACE

IN SOMEONE ELSE’S PERSONAL BUBBLE MAKES
YOU PRETTY VULNERABLE TO BEING ATTACKED!

BUT FOR CATS, IT’S A SIGN OF FRIENDSHIP
AND TRUST.

DURING A NOSE BUMP, CATS CAN IDENTIFY EACH
OTHER WHILE ALSO USING FACIAL SCENT GLANDS

ON THE LIPS, CHIN, AND CHEEKS, TO SPREAD THEIR
OWN FRAGRANCE.

EACH CAT HAS A UNIQUE SCENT SIGNATURE THAT
CAN TELL OTHERS WHAT GROUP THEY BELONG TO

AND WHERE THEY’VE BEEN.
WHILE WASHING ITSELF, A CAT TRANSFERS THIS

SCENT FROM IT’S MOUTH GLANDS TO IT’S FUR
SO THAT IT CAN BE SPREAD TO OBJECTS, OR IN

SOME CASES PEOPLE.
IF A CAT NOTICES OTHER CATS WITH UNFAMILIAR

SCENTS, IT WILL MARK IT’S TERRITORY ON THEM
BY RUBBING ITS FACE ON THEIR HEAD DURING THE

NOSE BUMP.
SINCE SMELL IS A CAT’S STRONGEST SENSE,

IT’S UNDERSTANDABLE WHY IT’S ALSO THEIR
FIRST FORM OF COMMUNICATION.

NOSE BUMPS START WHEN THEY ARE TEENY, TINY
KITTENS WHO, DESPITE BEING BLIND AND DEAF,

HAVE FULLY DEVELOPED SENSES OF TOUCH AND SMELL.
WITH THESE BASIC SENSES, KITTENS LEAVE THEIR

SCENT ON THEIR MOTHER WHEN NURSING AND RETURN
TO THE SAME SPOT EACH FEEDING TIME

THE MOTHER CAT LEARNS TO IDENTIFY EACH KITTEN
BASED ON THEIR SMELL AND HER OWN SCENT ON

THEM.
IF YOU COULD MAKE YOUR CAT SMELL LIKE ANYTHING,

WHAT WOULD IT BE?
LET ME KNOW IN THE COMMENTS BELOW.

SO WE ALL KNOW CATS ALSO USE THEIR SENSE OF
SMELL WHILE THEY EAT! WHICH LEADS ME TO OUR

SPONSOR, Meow Mix has the irresistible tastes
cats love and the wholesome nutrition they

need to make the most of mealtime. And now
there are new mealtime favorites to give your

cat even more variety. Introducing Meow Mix
Tender Centers with Vitality Bursts and Meow

Mix Soufflés. With so many delicious flavors,
it’s no wonder Meow Mix cat food is the

only brand cats ask for by name.
BE SURE TO CHECK OUT THESE OTHER VIDEOS AND

SUBSCRIBE.
BYE!

comments.author: Isabella  Said

comments.text:
Completely wrong about smell being a cat's strongest sense. To see how 
wrong you are, let me put it in relative terms: a cat's sense of smell is 
perhaps 10 times better than a human's and perhaps 500 times weaker than a 
basset hound's. In fact, a cat's balance of senses is basically the same as 
a human's. Sight and sound are the strongest, they are what drive their 
perception, and smell is just a footnote.﻿

them as her kitten. Furthermore, if we are the owner of the cat (and close 
to her of course), our scent wouldn't be a problem for her even if we touch 
her kitten. Either we already have her scent or the cat already familiar 
with our scent on her kitten and said "oh...that's ok. " :D﻿
